translation.en: [reporter 1] Next to the woman. Talking to the woman right now.
Coming in the door right now. Got him. There he is. That's him.
Tim, how'd it go?
Allegations against one basketball ref of betting on
translation.ko: "도박 스캔들" 한 농구 심판이 경기 결과에 베팅했고

translation.en: and even tilting the outcome of games is rocking the NBA.
translation.ko: 경기 결과마저 뒤집었다는 혐의가 NBA를 뒤흔들고 있습니다

translation.en: [anchor 1] Commissioner David Stern said today
it is the worst situation he has faced
translation.ko: 미국 프로 농구 협회 수장으로서 지금과 같은 최악의 상황은 처음 겪는다고 밝혔습니다

translation.en: as head of the National Basketball Association.
translation.ko: 지금과 같은 최악의 상황은 처음 겪는다고 밝혔습니다 "NBA 스캔들"

translation.en: This is not anything other than an act of betrayal.
[news anchor 2] Former NBA ref Tim Donaghy
pleaded guilty to betting on basketball games,
translation.ko: 농구 경기에 베팅했다는 혐의에 유죄를 인정했는데

translation.en: including games in which he was officiating.
translation.ko: 그중에는 자신이 심판을 맡은 경기도 포함돼 있습니다

translation.en: [anchor 3] This amid allegations
Donaghy may have been working with the Mafia
in a point-shaving scandal.
An official entrusted with the integrity of the game,
translation.ko: 경기를 공정하게 진행해 주리라 믿었던 심판이

translation.en: now said to be receiving death threats.
[reporter 2] Did your client ever make a call on the basketball court
translation.ko: 도너기 심판이 도박꾼과의 관계에 영향을 받고

translation.en: that was influenced by his association with gamblers?
translation.ko: 농구 코트에서 판정을 한 적이 있나요?

translation.en: There was no suggestion that he did anything inappropriate with respect to calling those games.
translation.ko: 경기 중 부적절한 판정이 있었음을 암시하는 내용은 전혀 없었습니다

translation.en: This is not a situation where games were manipulated or fixed.
[reporter 2] He denies that it ever took place?
Absolutely unconditionally.
Uh, what are we doing here?
I know what we're doing here, right?
We… We are trying to figure out about Timmy's games.
[announcer] Tim Donaghy, one of the officials…
translation.ko: 오늘 심판 중 한 명인 팀 도너기가…

translation.en: Everybody always asked, "Did he fix the games?" "Did he fix the games? Did he fix the games?" You know.
translation.ko: 티미가 승부를 조작했는지 사람들이 늘 물어봐요

translation.en: [anchor] Donaghy's two alleged coconspirators,
Thomas Martino and James Battista.
He fixed them like a motherfucker. He was the greatest.
translation.ko: 놈은 승부를 제대로 조작했어요 혀를 내두를 정도로 대단했죠

translation.en: That's my only positive thing I could say about him.
translation.ko: 티미에 관해 제가 유일하게 긍정적으로 할 수 있는 얘기예요

translation.en: There was nobody that can control the whistle like Timmy did.
translation.ko: 티미처럼 휘슬을 마음껏 조종할 수 있는 사람은 없었어요

translation.en: One night he said it to me… And I remember he said it.
translation.ko: 어느 날 밤 티미가 이런 말을 한 기억이 나요

translation.en: "I can influence games six points either way."
translation.ko: 어느 경기든 6점까지는 자기가 좌지우지할 수 있다고요

translation.en: -["Drinkin’ Problem" by Midland playing] -♪ I call it a solution ♪
[Tim] I did something that was stupid and unfathomable.
translation.ko: 전 어리석고 이해할 수 없는 짓을 했어요

translation.en: I had a great job. Great family, nice house, great cars.
translation.ko: 훌륭한 직장에서 일했고 좋은 가족, 집, 차까지 있었는데…

translation.en: Man, did I fuck my life up.
I grew up in Delaware County.
I loved the game of basketball growing up.
It's all I did, all I dreamt of, and all I wanted to be a part of.
translation.ko: 농구만 하면서 오직 농구만을 꿈꿨죠 "팀 도너기"

translation.en: Growing up outside Philadelphia, the Sixers were great at the time.
translation.ko: 필라델피아 외곽에서 자라던 당시 식서스는 대단했어요

translation.en: They won a Championship.
-I never missed a game. -[whistling]
My dad was a successful college referee.
[announcer] The officials? Jerry Donaghy from Havertown, Pennsylvania. David…
translation.ko: 펜실베이니아주 헤이버타운 출신 제리 도너기 심판과…

translation.en: [Tim] You know, I saw the friendships that he made with other officials.
translation.ko: 다른 심판들과 친분을 쌓으시는 걸 봤죠

translation.en: I saw the excitement that you get
by being a part of the game at a very young age.
Delaware County's famous for being where a lot of NBA referees are from.
translation.ko: 델라웨어 카운티는 NBA 심판을 많이 배출한 곳으로 유명해요

translation.en: -[blows whistle] -T! Right here!
[Tim] Like Joe Crawford was a legend in Delaware County.
You! Out of here!
[Tim] Then you have Javie, Strom, Middleton,
Callahan, Washington.
Nowitzki! Knock it off!
[Tim] They were all from Philadelphia, so I thought to myself,
translation.ko: 필라델피아 출신들이 그렇게 활약하는 걸 보고

translation.en: "If they can do it, why… why couldn't I?"
[video narrator] Welcome to the introduction to officiating mechanics.
[referee] This is how you start the clock. Disallowing a basket. No score.
translation.ko: 경기 시작 신호입니다 골 불인정, 무득점

translation.en: Shot is made. Touchdown.
Three points.
Travel.
Blocking. Holding. Pushing.
Charging.
[Tim] The NBA gave me a ticket to go out to California for my first NBA camp.
translation.ko: NBA에서 캘리포니아행 표를 줘서 첫 NBA 캠프에 참석했고

translation.en: From there, I was put on the staff to officiate in the CBA.
translation.ko: 그 후로 저는 CBA 심판을 맡게 됐어요

translation.en: [announcer] Personable gentleman, nice to talk with.
[woman] I was a flight attendant, and Tim was in the CBA,
translation.ko: 저는 비행기 승무원이었고 팀은 CBA에서 일할 때였죠

translation.en: which are the farm teams.
He came on my plane at six o'clock in the morning one morning,
translation.ko: 어느 날 아침 6시에 제가 근무하는 비행기를 탄 팀은

translation.en: and he was as cute and cocky as all get-out,
translation.ko: 매력적이고 자신감 넘치는 모습이었어요 "킴 스트럽 도너기"

translation.en: and he said, "I'm gonna sit right by you."
And I said, "No, you're not. You're gonna sit in your seat." [laughs]
translation.ko: 그러면 안 되니까 본인 자리에 앉으시라고 했죠

translation.en: And he sat right by me. [laughs]
And so he just instantly made me laugh.
translation.ko: 그렇게 처음 만났을 때부터 저를 웃게 만들었죠

translation.en: And made me laugh all the way from Moline to Chicago.
translation.ko: 몰린에서 시카고에 도착할 때까지 계속 웃게 했어요

translation.en: We got married on a beach. I was pregnant and barefoot.
translation.ko: 우린 해변에서 결혼했어요 전 임신 중이었고 맨발이었죠

translation.en: It was just he and I, right in front of the water.
We gave a disposable camera to someone who was standing there,
translation.ko: 근처에 있는 사람에게 일회용 카메라를 건네주며

translation.en: and they snapped the pictures, and that was it. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 사진을 찍어 달라고 했고 그게 저희의 결혼식이었어요

translation.en: When he told me that his goal was to get into the NBA,
I thought, "That… That's great. That's fantastic."
"What a neat thing. You know, there are only 50 of them in the whole country."
So really, whatever I could do to support him, I did.
translation.ko: 그래서 할 수 있는 건 뭐든 하며 뒷바라지했어요

translation.en: [Tim] When you're going through the minor leagues,
translation.ko: 마이너 리그 심판 일을 하다 보면

translation.en: there's a lot of lonely days on the road.
translation.ko: 여러 지역을 다니며 외로운 날이 많아요

translation.en: And you're saying, "Is this all worth it?"
"Am I gonna make it? Am I going to be the one chosen?"
translation.ko: 내가 해낼 수 있을지 선택받게 될지 의구심도 생기죠

translation.en: The day that he got the phone call,
he called me, and he said, "I got in."
Three words. I got in.
-[crowd cheering] -[announcer 1] Officials tonight. Paul Mihalak, Blane Reichelt, and Tim Donaghy.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤 심판은 폴 미할릭 블레인 라이첼트, 팀 도너기입니다

translation.en: Mihalak, Reichelt, and Donaghy.
[Tim] My first NBA game after I was hired was Houston at Indiana.
translation.ko: NBA 심판이 된 후 첫 번째 경기는 휴스턴 대 인디애나 경기였어요

translation.en: [announcer 1] And the Rockets win the tip.
[Tim] Reggie Miller, he loved to hold and grab coming off screens.
translation.ko: 레지 밀러는 스크린 하는 사람을 홀딩하거나 붙잡길 잘하고

translation.en: He loved to pump-fake and jump into people.
translation.ko: 페이크 슈팅이나 밀치는 걸 좋아하는 선수였어요

translation.en: It was a close game.
[announcer 1] Taking it down to Olajuwon. Spinning to the middle.
translation.ko: 올라주원 쪽으로 갑니다 미들로 스핀 무브!

translation.en: [Tim] I made a call at the end of the game where Reggie Miller
translation.ko: 경기 막판에 레지 밀러에게 파울을 줬어요

translation.en: jumped into Hakeem Olajuwon. Threw his shoulder right into him.
-[whistle blows] -[announcer 1] And Olajuwon fouled.
They're gonna call an offensive foul on Reggie Miller!
Oh boy, that took a lot of guts by that young official,
and boy, look at the debris come out on the court…
[Tim] The Indiana fans just went berserk
and were throwing stuff on the floor for, felt like, two hours.
translation.ko: 바닥에 물건을 던져대는데 한 2시간은 지난 기분이었어요

translation.en: I kept saying to Paul Mehalik, you know,
"There's only a couple seconds left in the game."
"Just put the ball in play."
He says, "I can't!"
He says, "It's like a hockey rink out here. Somebody's gonna get hurt."
translation.ko: 무슨 하키 경기장도 아니고 이러다간 누구 하나 다칠 거라고요

translation.en: [announcer 1] I've never seen anything like it.
This is my tenth year, and I have never seen this before. Never.
translation.ko: 올해로 중계만 10년째인데 한 번도 본 적 없는 장면입니다

translation.en: The Houston Rockets, trying to get off the court in a hurry.
[Tim] The supervisor at the time took the game tape.
translation.ko: 그때 제 상사가 경기 녹화 영상을 가져가면서

translation.en: He looked at me, and he said,
"We'll find out real quick if you'll make it in this league."
translation.ko: '자네가 리그에서 버틸 수 있을지 빨리 확인해 봐야겠군'

translation.en: And we went back to the hotel room and watched the tape.
translation.ko: 함께 호텔방으로 돌아가서 영상을 본 후

translation.en: And he said it was the right call.
[announcer 1] If this young man's gonna grow up to be an official in this league,
translation.ko: 이 젊은이가 이 리그에서 심판으로 자리 잡으려면

translation.en: he's going to have to make the tough call, and he did the right thing.
translation.ko: 힘든 결정을 내려야 할 텐데요 옳은 판단을 한 겁니다

translation.en: When Tim was hired by the NBA,
I could just tell his whole demeanor changed.
translation.ko: 태도가 달라졌다는 걸 알 수 있었어요

translation.en: He was like, "Yes."
[announcer 1] Jason Kidd, beautiful move around Kenny Smith.
translation.ko: 제이슨 키드, 멋진 동작입니다 케니 스미스를 제치고 슛 성공 반칙까지 받아냅니다

translation.en: It goes, and he's fouled.
translation.ko: 케니 스미스를 제치고 슛 성공 반칙까지 받아냅니다

translation.en: [man] You know, I never really cared for the NBA.
I used to watch it just because Tim was reffing the games.
[Kim] Tommy has been, and will always be, Tim's partner in crime.
translation.ko: "토미 마르티노" 토미는 팀의 공범이에요 예전에 그랬듯 앞으로도 그렇겠죠

translation.en: The two of them fed off of each other.
[Tommy] I made a lot of bad decisions as a kid.
translation.ko: 어릴 때 나쁜 짓을 많이 했어요

translation.en: One day, when I was in first grade,
this bird took a shit on the pole.
translation.ko: 전봇대에서 새가 똥 싸는 걸 보고…

translation.en: And I'm thinking to myself,
I wanted to taste the bird shit.
So I tasted the bird shit.
I felt, like, this out-of-body experience,
translation.ko: 어디서도 느끼지 못할 기분을 느끼는 동시에

translation.en: and I knew I did something wrong.
translation.ko: 하면 안 될 짓을 했다는 걸 깨달았죠

translation.en: Maybe early on,
I had a penchant for risk-taking.
[Tim chuckling] One of those guys that all the girls loved.
Athletic, funny, good-looking kid that everybody liked.
translation.ko: 모두가 좋아하는 운동 잘하고 재미있고 잘생긴 아이였죠

translation.en: He had good street smarts. Easygoing, always made people happy.
translation.ko: 세상 물정에 밝았어요 느긋하고 늘 사람들을 행복하게 해서

translation.en: You wanted to be around Tommy.
[Tommy] Baba and Donaghy were not friends. They were acquaintances.
translation.ko: 바바와 도너기는 친구라기보다는 아는 사이였어요 "바티스타, 도너기"

translation.en: I was friends with Jimmy. I was friends with Timmy.
-[ominous music playing] -I was their link.
All three of us went to Cardinal O'Hara High School together.
translation.ko: 셋은 카디널 오하라 고등학교에 같이 다녔어요

translation.en: Tim was hilarious.
He was the prankster, you know. He was the guy pulling the fire alarm.
translation.ko: 장난꾸러기였거든요 화재경보기를 울리는 그런 애요 "방과 후 남기"

translation.en: Jimmy was a God-fearing, churchgoing boy just like we were.
And his family was very strict with him.
Maybe that's why he rebelled a little bit.
translation.ko: 어쩌면 그래서 반항을 좀 했는지도 몰라요

translation.en: And got mixed up with them guys.
[Jimmy] I graduated high school by the skin of my teeth
'cause I didn't give a fuck.
translation.ko: 학교 같은 건 신경 안 썼거든요 "지미 '바바' 바티스타"

translation.en: But I got a job at a restaurant called Lombardo's.
Louis Lombardo, Lump, he gave me a job, and I worked as a waiter.
translation.ko: 루이 롬바르도, 일명 럼프 밑에서 웨이터로 일하게 되면서

translation.en: I saw a different side of the world.
People were drinking and partying in the '80s.
Coke was good. Money was good.
Everyone was living and loving life.
[announcer] Back at Wrigley Field, here are the lineups. For the Phillies…
translation.ko: 다시 리글리 구장입니다 출전 명단을 보시죠, 필리스는…

translation.en: [Jimmy] There was a customer, wanted a special order.
He goes, "Can I get a dime on the Phillies tonight?"
Lump took the bet.
[announcer] Double-play ball! Nice play out at second! And Cubs win!
[Jimmy] Phillies lost that night.
Here I am working, hoping to make 300 a night as a waiter.
"I said, "That motherfucker made $1,000 not doing nothing!"
translation.ko: 가만히 앉아 있던 인간이 1천 달러를 번 거예요!

translation.en: And right there, that started my love for gambling.
-[intriguing music playing] -A nickel was 500.
A dime is a thousand.
A stick is a hundred thousand.
And if you got into my world, you deal with balloons, and that was a million.
translation.ko: 우리 세계에 들어와서 풍선을 다루면 그건 100만 달러죠

translation.en: Nickel, dime, stick, and balloon.
If you didn't know what they were, you weren't invited to the party.
translation.ko: 그게 뭔지 모르면 도박에 참여할 수 없었어요

translation.en: The Animals…
We were a group of gambling bookmakers from the Philadelphia area.
We were young kids, booking, betting.
translation.ko: 베팅을 관리하고 직접 베팅도 하는 젊은이들이었고

translation.en: We became a player because our information and knowledge hurt people.
translation.ko: 우리의 정보와 지식으로 피해자가 생기며 주요 인물이 됐죠

translation.en: We were taking money out of people's pockets,
translation.ko: 사람들 주머니에서 돈을 뺏어 가는 실력이

translation.en: and we were good.
[announcer 1] This is a chance for 'em to put it away.
[Jimmy] Any sporting event that we can get inside information on.
translation.ko: 내부 정보를 얻을 수 있는 모든 스포츠 경기를 다뤘어요

translation.en: College football. College basketball.
NBA. We didn't care what league it was.
translation.ko: NBA 어떤 리그든 상관없었어요 바퀴벌레 두 마리가 뒹군다고 해도

translation.en: If it was two fucking cockroaches, it was about getting the right information.
translation.ko: 어떤 리그든 상관없었어요 바퀴벌레 두 마리가 뒹군다고 해도 제대로 된 정보를 얻어야 했죠

translation.en: And I had a good personality
to get information out of people on a one-to-one basis.
[announcer 3] He's gonna trap all over. They have nothing to lose,
translation.ko: 꼼짝없이 막혔네요 지금 잃을 게 없는 만큼

translation.en: so it's gonna be a half-court…
-And a technical foul is called. -[announcer 3] That's gonna be on Juwan--
-[announcer 4] Hanging on the rim. -[announcer 3] It won't…
[Tim] When you're hired into the league, you think everything is done
translation.ko: 리그에서 일하게 되면 모든 것이 규칙서에 나오는 대로 진행될 거라고 생각해요

translation.en: based on the rules how they're written in the rule book.
translation.ko: 모든 것이 규칙서에 나오는 대로 진행될 거라고 생각해요

translation.en: You quickly learn,
translation.ko: 하지만 살아남기 위해서는 규칙서만 따를 수 없다는 걸

translation.en: if you're gonna survive, that's not the way things are done.
translation.ko: 하지만 살아남기 위해서는 규칙서만 따를 수 없다는 걸 빨리 배우게 되죠

translation.en: I started to understand the game within the game
translation.ko: 저는 NBA 경기 속의 경기를 이해하기 시작했어요

translation.en: of the NBA, and I'll give you an example.
translation.ko: 저는 NBA 경기 속의 경기를 이해하기 시작했어요 예를 하나 들어 볼게요

translation.en: I was in Philadelphia, and I'm refereeing Sixers-Bulls.
translation.ko: 필라델피아에서 열린 불스 대 식서스 경기를 맡았어요

translation.en: They were cracking down on a spin move that they wanted the officials to call traveling.
translation.ko: 스핀 무브를 트래블링으로 엄격하게 판정하던 때였는데

translation.en: And Michael Jordan does the spin move, and I make the call.
translation.ko: 마이클 조던이 스핀 무브를 해서 제가 파울을 불었죠

translation.en: [announcer] Michael on the block, travel.
[Tim] Phil Jackson comes flying off the bench, and he starts giving me shit.
translation.ko: 필 잭슨이 벤치에서 날뛰며 저한테 강하게 어필하는 거예요

translation.en: And I say, "Wait a second, Phil. You know as well as I do,
that's the spin move that they're telling us to call."
translation.ko: '저런 스핀 무브를 하면 파울을 불어야 한다는 걸요'

translation.en: And he said, "They may want that play called,
translation.ko: 그러자 대답하더군요 '저걸 파울로 잡고 싶어는 하지만'

translation.en: but they certainly don't want it called on him."
translation.ko: '저 친구의 파울로 잡는 건 원치 않을걸요'

translation.en: And he pointed at Jordan, who walked by and just stared at me.
translation.ko: 그리고 저를 노려보며 지나가는 조던을 가리켰죠

translation.en: I got in the locker room. The other referee said,
translation.ko: 라커 룸에 들어갔는데 다른 심판이 그러더군요

translation.en: "They want that call, but don't call it on him."
translation.ko: '다들 파울 부는 걸 원하지만 조던에겐 불지 마요'

translation.en: The way David Stern structured the league,
we as officials knew that it was better
to treat the star players better than others.
I just wanted to be the best referee and advance up the ladder,
translation.ko: 저는 그저 최고의 심판이 되어 계속 위로 올라가고 싶었고

translation.en: and I saw the way guys that were in the NBA Finals
translation.ko: NBA 파이널의 심판들이 경기를 운영하는 방식을

translation.en: handled the game.
They didn't call fouls against the stars, and they were well-respected.
translation.ko: 스타들에게는 반칙을 안 불었는데 그래도 존중받더군요

translation.en: These people that pay thousands of dollars to sit courtside here,
translation.ko: 수천 달러를 내고 코트사이드에 앉은 사람들은

translation.en: they didn't come here to see Kobe Bryant, LeBron James,
translation.ko: 코비 브라이언트나 르브론 제임스, 샤킬 오닐이

translation.en: Shaquille O'Neal sit on the bench.
They came to see them play.
translation.ko: 그 선수들이 뛰는 걸 보러 왔으니까요

translation.en: The league's your boss, and you want them to think
you're doing a good job because, if that's the case,
you're on that playoff roster that comes out.
With that is an enormous amount more money and… and respect.
translation.ko: 엄청난 돈과 존경을 손에 넣게 되는 거예요

translation.en: -[knocking] -[official] Yo! Timothy!
[Tim] As an official, if you were on a ten-day trip
and you were with the same guys, it was like a brotherhood.
translation.ko: 같은 사람들과 여정을 함께하면 형제애가 생기는 기분이에요

translation.en: You became family, really.
Scott Foster, he was, you know, like a brother to me.
It was written in the contract that you couldn't place a bet of any kind.
translation.ko: 계약서에는 어떤 종류의 내기도 허용되지 않는다고 쓰여 있었어요

translation.en: Whether it was a golf match or going to a casino.
A lot of the referees went to the casinos on the road and liked to gamble.
translation.ko: 하지만 많은 심판이 이동 중에 카지노에 가서 도박하는 걸 좋아했죠

translation.en: Sometimes we'd play little games as officials.
A lot of times, starting the games,
we would bet who called the first foul of the game.
translation.ko: 누가 가장 먼저 파울을 부는지에 내기를 걸었어요

translation.en: [announcer 1] That's slapped away by Strickland.
[Tim] Twenty bucks, thirty bucks, fifty bucks, dinner that night.
We did it one time and got to the two or three-minute mark of the first quarter,
and bodies were fucking flying all over the place.
translation.ko: 다들 몸을 날리는데 그런 난장판이 또 없었죠

translation.en: -A lot of that stuff went on. -[intriguing music continues]
[announcer 2] Now he's not getting the call--
[announcer 3] And a technical foul. Tim Donaghy calls a technical.
translation.ko: 테크니컬 파울입니다 팀 도너기가 테크니컬을 줍니다

translation.en: And his second one. And Tim Donaghy has missed several calls tonight,
translation.ko: 두 번째입니다 오늘 팀 도너기는 파울을 몇 개 주지 않았는데

translation.en: and when Mike Dunleavy complains, Donaghy tosses him out of the game.
[Kim] When I noticed that things were shifting,
translation.ko: 상황이 바뀌고 있다는 걸 알았을 때쯤

translation.en: he would come home,
and I didn't know
what Tim I was gonna get when he walked in the door.
translation.ko: 팀이 문을 열고 들어올 때 어떤 모습일지를요

translation.en: I didn't know if I was gonna get happy, fun Tim
or if I was gonna get the Tim that dropped his bag
translation.ko: 계단 밑에 가방을 떨궈 놓은 채

translation.en: at the bottom of the stairs and just walk up to his room
translation.ko: 자기 방으로 올라가서 전화기를 붙잡고 있는

translation.en: and get on the phone.
[announcer 3] And Bonzi Wells has been tossed,
and Tim Donaghy with quick whistles all night long.
translation.ko: 팀 도너기는 오늘 경기 내내 재빨리 휘슬을 붑니다

translation.en: And Bonzi Wells now joins Mike Dunleavy in the Portland locker room.
translation.ko: 본지 웰스가 마이크 던리비에 이어 라커 룸으로 퇴장당합니다

translation.en: [announcer 2] You can't touch the official.
Right over the house.
[Kim] Tim, it probably wouldn't be a very good idea.
My parents still have nine months left here.
translation.ko: 부모님은 앞으로 9개월은 더 여기서 사셔야 해

translation.en: [Kim] I only knew who he was talking to when somebody called the house phone,
translation.ko: 누군가 집으로 전화하면 저는 그게 누구인지만 알았는데

translation.en: and it was usually Jack.
[Tim] Jack Concannon was a guy from Delaware County.
We played golf three, four times a week together.
translation.ko: 일주일에 서너 번은 같이 골프를 쳤죠 "2003년"

translation.en: Jack and I started betting, uh… football, baseball.
translation.ko: 잭과 저는 풋볼과 야구에 베팅하기 시작했어요

translation.en: We just had a lot of fun together.
When Jack would call the house,
I would say, "Tim, your girlfriend's on the phone."
And he immediately knew that it was Jack
because they talked five, six, seven times a day.
translation.ko: 전화가 오면 잭인 걸 바로 알았죠

translation.en: [Tim] It had 15 plays on it a day that, win or lose,
it could mean five or ten thousand dollars.
We kind of went in partners.
He put the bets in, and at the end of the week, we would square up.
translation.ko: 잭이 베팅하면 한 주가 끝날 즈음 정산했어요

translation.en: And then, I'll never forget, one time we went to play golf.
translation.ko: 잭과 함께 골프 치러 간 날을 잊을 수가 없을 거예요

translation.en: Before we played, he said,
"Give me some winners of… of the games tonight in the NBA."
translation.ko: 그날 밤 NBA 경기 승자가 누구일지 말해 보라고요

translation.en: And I looked at the lines in the paper.
I knew who was refereeing the games because I looked at the master schedule.
translation.ko: 이미 경기 일정표를 봐서 누가 심판을 맡는지 알았죠

translation.en: I gave him three plays,
and he called me up the next day and said, "Is it really that easy?"
translation.ko: 다음 날 전화로 그러더군요 '그렇게 쉽게 가능해?'

translation.en: And I said, "Wh… What happened?"
And he goes, "They all won."
[Jimmy] Jack Concannon was booking with The Animals.
Jack was a nickel better.
Jack's bets went up in denomination.
From him betting a nickel, and he's up to two dimes or three dimes.
And I'm like, "Jack's not a two or three dime bettor."
translation.ko: 그 정도 통은 안 되는 사람이었거든요

translation.en: So I'm like, "Oh. What the hell's going on here?"
[Tim] There was a lot of different information I could use to make these picks.
translation.ko: 승자를 예측할 때 사용할 수 있는 정보는 다양해요

translation.en: Referees would share information with each other.
Maybe a referee had an issue with a coach or a player.
translation.ko: 심판이 감독이나 선수와 문제가 있었을 수도 있죠

translation.en: Maybe a trainer came into the locker room
translation.ko: 경기 전에 트레이너가 라커 룸에 들어와서

translation.en: before the game, said a couple of their players were hurt.
translation.ko: 선수 몇 명이 다쳤다고 알릴 수도 있는 거고요

translation.en: A lot of it was inside information.
[Kim] I was very well aware of the rule
translation.ko: 심판은 도박을 하면 안 된다는 규칙을

translation.en: that referees were not allowed to bet on anything.
I remember telling him,
"You better be careful."
"If you go down, you're gonna take our whole family down with you."
translation.ko: '당신이 무너지면 우리 가정도 함께 무너지는 거야'

translation.en: [Tim] Didn't need the money.
Between stock investments, between playoff bonuses,
I was making well close to 400,000 a year.
I was near a line that I shouldn't have been near
and then jumped over it, giving picks
translation.ko: 그 선을 뛰어넘어서 제가 심판을 맡는

translation.en: on games that I was officiating in the NBA.
[Jimmy] I find out that Jack was betting Timmy's games.
translation.ko: 티미가 심판하는 경기에 잭이 베팅한다는 걸 알게 됐어요

translation.en: And if he's got that information,
so I take it and run with it.
So if they were betting four or five dimes a game,
then we'll just bet ten or 20 times the amount.
He was a cash cow. It was incredible.
-Years later… -[metallic whoosh]
…I had a major falling-out with The Animals.
And we went our separate ways.
And that's when I decided to go after Tim.
♪ I want to be forever young ♪ ♪ Do you really want to live forever? ♪
Go sit down, bitch!
Tommy, Patty, just wanna say congratulations.
I wish you the best of luck. Going to be a long life.
I hope you have many little kids, honey.
God bless you. I love you, Tommy, from the bottom of my heart.
translation.ko: 신의 축복이 있기를 토미, 진심으로 사랑해

translation.en: Patty, take care of him. He's the best-paying boss in the world.
translation.ko: 패티, 잘 부탁해, 세상에서 돈을 가장 잘 주는 상사야

translation.en: -Thank you, I love you. [kisses] -[music fades]
[Tommy] Baba said, "When is Timmy in town again?"
"I need to meet up with him. He's in trouble."
I said, "What? Tim? What do you mean he's in trouble?"
He goes, "Set up a meeting with him."
So I said, "Okay."
I remember one time mentioning Battista's name
translation.ko: 그로부터 수년 전 통화 중에 도너기에게

translation.en: to Donaghy on the phone years before that,
translation.ko: 바티스타의 이름을 한 번 언급한 기억이 있는데

translation.en: and he goes, "Tom, don't even mention his name on the phone with me."
translation.ko: 도너기는 그 친구 이름을 전화상으로 언급하지 말라고 했죠

translation.en: He said, "I cannot be associated
with anything like bookmaking
or betting or anything like that."
So I never said that Battista wanted to meet up with him.
translation.ko: "2006년 12월 12일" 그래서 팀에게 바티스타가 만나고 싶어 한다는 말을 안 했죠

translation.en: [producer] Why is everybody's story about the Marriott so different?
translation.ko: 왜 메리어트에 관해서 각자 하는 말이 다를까요?

translation.en: I think it's a… it's a… it's a, um…
Dave, could we cut for a sec?
[Tim] Tommy called me up and said he wanted to have dinner with me.
translation.ko: 토미가 전화해서 같이 저녁 먹자고 했어요

translation.en: He shows up with Battista, and I said to him immediately,
"Tommy, what the fuck is he doing here? I can't be seen with him."
translation.ko: '토미, 지금 뭐 하는 짓이야? 같이 있다가 눈에 띄면 안 돼'

translation.en: -[tense music continues] -[Tommy] He looked at Battista,
and then he looked at me like he saw a ghost.
We sat down at the table. Battista said,
"Timmy, look, I know you're giving the games to Jack."
translation.ko: '티미, 잭한테 경기 결과를 예측해 주는 거 알아'

translation.en: He said he knew that I had been giving Jack
picks for the last couple of years, and he was getting those picks…
translation.ko: 결과를 예측해 준 걸 알고 있으며 자기도 그걸 받아 왔고

translation.en: …and he wanted to continue to get those picks.
[Jimmy] And I said, "Let's work together."
"But make me the sole guy."
[Jimmy] Battista wrote on a napkin, "2K,"
and he held up the napkin.
He goes, "I'll give you this. Give them to me."
translation.ko: '이만큼 줄 테니 나한테 예측 결과를 넘겨'

translation.en: I made him the greatest deal in the world.
If we win the bets, I'll give you two dimes.
-You're not gonna pay on your losses. -[metallic whoosh]
translation.ko: 예측이 빗나가도 보상할 필요는 없다고 했어요 "예측 불발 시 별도의 보상 없음"

translation.en: Just fucking pick me winners. Give me the right side.
translation.ko: 승자만 골라 달라고요 정답만 알려 달라고 했어요

translation.en: [Tim] Tommy goes to the bathroom.
I was alone with Battista.
He says,
"You don't want us calling the NBA and telling them what you've been doing."
translation.ko: '네가 해 온 일을 NBA에 알리는 건 원치 않잖아'

translation.en: "Worse yet, you don't want somebody from New York
visiting your wife and kids in Florida."
translation.ko: '네 처자식을 찾아가는 건 더 싫을 테고'

translation.en: [Kim] Okay, here's Bridget! Bridget's first birthday!
translation.ko: 자, 브리짓이에요 브리짓의 첫 번째 생일이네요

translation.en: [Tim] And when he said that, I was scared.
You know, not really of Battista
but people that he was most likely dealing with.
[Kim] All right, are you ready?
[Tim] The job I had, the family I had,
I really didn't have a choice.
[Kim and Tim] Yay!
[producer] Had he not made the threat, would you have bet with him?
No.
No. If it wasn't for that, I definitely would not have bet with him
because I knew he was just a… a schmuck and an asshole.
translation.ko: 그 녀석이 멍청이에 얼간이라는 걸 알고 있었으니까요

translation.en: Anyone that had anything to do with him
always, you know, moved away from him.
Timmy was fucking thrilled to work with us. To make money.
translation.ko: 티미는 우리와 함께 일하며 돈 벌 생각에 신이 났어요

translation.en: [announcer] That's a tough call. I think it's the correct call…
translation.ko: 어려운 결정입니다 훌륭한 판결인 것 같고요

translation.en: Of all the fucked-up things I did,
translation.ko: 내가 온갖 못 할 짓을 다 했지만

translation.en: never threatened him.
You don't win people over threatening people.
translation.ko: 사람을 협박해서는 마음을 살 수 없거든요

translation.en: You get farther with honey.
translation.ko: 채찍보다는 당근이 더 잘 먹히는 법이에요

translation.en: [Tommy] I did not see Battista threaten Donaghy,
translation.ko: 바티스타가 도너기를 협박하는 건 못 봤어요

translation.en: and Battista's pissed off about this because he doesn't wanna be portrayed
translation.ko: 바티스타가 완전 열받았죠 가정을 위협하는 사람으로 묘사되길 원치 않으니까요

translation.en: as the type of person that would go threaten people's families,
translation.ko: 가정을 위협하는 사람으로 묘사되길 원치 않으니까요

translation.en: and I don't think he is that type of person.
translation.ko: 저도 바티스타가 그런 사람이라고 보지 않고요

translation.en: I know he's not.
To me, it wasn't a life-or-death situation.
If it was, I would have bailed.
I'm not into that shit, you know?
[Tim] After our meeting at the Marriott that night,
I was in town to referee Boston at Philly.
translation.ko: 보스턴 대 필라델피아 경기를 심판하러 갔어요

translation.en: The day prior, I was refereeing with Derrick Stafford.
translation.ko: 그 전날에는 데릭 스태퍼드와 심판을 맡았는데

translation.en: He had said he felt like Mo Cheeks had no idea what he was doing,
translation.ko: 모 치크스가 뭘 알지도 못하면서 감독을 한다고 말하더군요

translation.en: and his heart wasn't into coaching, and not only that,
translation.ko: 그 사람이 신경 쓰는 건 팀을 감독하는 게 아니랬죠

translation.en: Philly was tanking games for better draft picks,
so they really weren't trying.
So, I told Battista to bet Boston.
translation.ko: 그래서 바티스타한테 보스턴에 걸라고 했어요 "도너기의 승리 예측 팀: 보스턴"

translation.en: [announcer 1] …rebounding now.
Telfair quickly ahead to Allen. Allen takes it right at Iguodala for two.
translation.ko: 텔페어, 앨런에게 재빨리 패스 앨런이 이궈달라를 제치고 2득점

translation.en: [announcer 2] Boy, that's what I like, quick up the floor.
[announcer 1] Pierce 0 for 2 to start the game, and Iguodala goes coast to coast.
translation.ko: 피어스는 슛을 두 번 다 놓쳤고 이궈달라는 코트를 가로지릅니다

translation.en: Seven-point Philly lead, their biggest of the night.
translation.ko: 7점 차로 앞서가는 필라델피아 오늘 가장 큰 점수 차군요

translation.en: -Iguodala, his second steal and basket. -[dramatic electric guitar playing]
translation.ko: 이궈달라, 두 번째 스틸 성공 후 득점까지 연결합니다

translation.en: Pierce to Allen, rebound, and he got fouled.
Donaghy coming in from the outside.
[announcer 2] Boy, and that booing in Philly.
I don't ever remember hearing them boo in Philly.
translation.ko: "보스턴 80 필라델피아 61" 필라델피아 관중의 야유를 들은 기억이 없는데요

translation.en: At their own team!
[announcer 1] The Philadelphia losing streak gets longer,
and Boston climbs to 8 and 13 now
-on the season. -[buzzer ringing]
translation.ko: 보스턴은 이번 시즌 8승 13패로 올라섭니다 "도너기가 예측한 팀 승리"

translation.en: After the Boston game, Battista came to me, and he said,
translation.ko: 보스턴 경기가 끝난 후 바티스타가 제게 와서 말했어요

translation.en: "Tim's new nickname is Elvis. Because he's the king."
translation.ko: '팀의 새 별명은 엘비스야 팀이 바로 왕이니까'

translation.en: -[upbeat music playing] -And he was the king.
[Tim] Battista was placing the bets,
getting the information through Tommy that came through me.
I would never talk to Timmy. He had to go through Tommy.
translation.ko: 난 티미랑 얘기 안 했어요 토미를 거쳐야 했거든요

translation.en: [Tommy] Timmy would tell me who we would bet on
by my brothers' names.
My brother Johnny moved to Jersey. He was the away team.
translation.ko: 저지로 이사한 제 동생 조니는 원정 팀이었어요

translation.en: My brother Chuck stayed here, so he was the home team.
translation.ko: 이곳에 남은 동생 척은 홈 팀이었고요

translation.en: He'd say, "Hey, Tommy, what's going on? I'm in, uh, Boston."
translation.ko: 이런 식이죠, '토미, 잘 지내? 난 보스턴에 있어'

translation.en: "Hey, how's Johnny doing?"
Yeah, "How's Johnny doing?" Or, "Who's he having Thanksgiving with?"
"All right, call me tomorrow."
[Tommy] And I would relay it back to Battista.
translation.ko: 그러면 그 내용을 바티스타에게 다시 전달했죠

translation.en: [Jimmy] I made a lot of money.
There was a few million bet on each game that I was in control of.
translation.ko: 제가 관리하는 판돈만 몇백만 달러였거든요 "바티스타는 경기당 200만~300만 달러를 운용함"

translation.en: I was moving the most prominent gamblers in the world.
translation.ko: 세계에서 가장 유명한 도박사들의 판돈을 맡은 거죠

translation.en: I'd just charge them half, quarter, or 1%. We're moving millions of dollars a day?
translation.ko: 0.5%, 0.25%, 1%씩 수수료를 받고 하루에 몇백만 달러를 굴렸으니

translation.en: -It was a printing press. Cash. -[upbeat music continues]
translation.ko: 돈 뽑는 기계처럼 현금이 줄줄 나왔어요

translation.en: [announcer 1] Pepsi Center tonight, the Utah Jazz,
translation.ko: "2007년 1월 6일 유타 대 덴버" 오늘 밤 펩시 센터에서 유타 재즈

translation.en: the top dog team in the Northwest Division at…
[Tim] Prior to this game,
Allen Iverson and Steve Javie had butted heads for years.
translation.ko: 앨런 아이버슨과 스티브 재비는 몇 년째 서로 충돌해 왔어요

translation.en: -I'm not gonna see everything, all right? -It happened so many times.
translation.ko: 모든 걸 볼 순 없잖아요 - 앨런, 난… - 이런 일이 한두 번이에요?

translation.en: [Tim] There was an issue where Iverson actually threatened Javie,
translation.ko: 아이버슨이 실제로 재비를 협박한 일이 있어서

translation.en: and we felt as a staff that Iverson should have been suspended.
translation.ko: 심판으로서 아이버슨을 출장 정지 시켜야 한다고 생각했죠

translation.en: We decided, before the game,
we were gonna call palming violations on him.
translation.ko: 캐링 더 볼 바이얼레이션을 아이버슨에게 주기로 합의했어요

translation.en: We knew he did it, we knew we could call it,
translation.ko: 아이버슨이 파울을 범했고 우린 파울을 불 수 있었지만

translation.en: but nobody ever did.
I even called up Javie that day and told him to watch the game
translation.ko: 그날 재비한테 전화해서 경기를 지켜보라고까지 했어요

translation.en: because we were gonna take justice into our own hands.
-[announcer 1] …Iverson. -[whistle blows]
[announcer 1] And we got a palming violation.
[Tim] Bernie called the first one. I called the second one.
translation.ko: 버니가 첫 번째 파울을 불었고 두 번째는 제가 불었어요

translation.en: It was a situation where it was gonna put Iverson at a disadvantage
and Denver at a disadvantage, so I told Battista to bet Utah.
translation.ko: 아이버슨과 덴버가 불리해질 상황이었기에 바티스타에게 유타에 베팅하라고 했죠

translation.en: [announcer 1] Nuggets down by just six. Here goes Iverson. Score!
translation.ko: "도너기의 승리 예측 팀: 유타" 너기츠가 6점 차로 따라붙었습니다 아이버슨의 슛, 득점!

translation.en: [announcer 2] He wants an and-one. He thought Fisher was bodying him.
translation.ko: 득점 후 파울로 연결되길 원하네요 피셔가 수비하리라 생각했군요

translation.en: [announcer 1] Tim Donaghy will not call a foul when Iverson goes to basket.
translation.ko: 레이업을 시도하는 아이버슨에게 도너기가 파울을 불지 않네요

translation.en: [announcer 1] And the Nuggets, going to score a season-low 84 points tonight.
translation.ko: 너기츠는 오늘 시즌 최저인 84점을 기록합니다 "유타 96 덴버 84"

translation.en: [Jimmy] Some of the games, I was like,
"Oh my God. Oh my God. Put that fuck… Don't… "
He was… Some of it was very obvious.
So I'm watching each game on the edge of my chair.
I need to relax.
Pop a few OxyContins. Chill.
[Kim] I always did Tim's laundry when he came home,
translation.ko: 팀이 집에 돌아올 때마다 빨래를 했는데

translation.en: and I went to throw his NBA jacket in the washing machine.
And I put my hand in the pocket,
and there was a wad of money about that big.
And I thought,
"Wow, that's a lot of money."
"I don't know if I want to know where it came from."
translation.ko: '어디서 났는지 모르는 게 좋을 것 같아'

translation.en: [reporter] John Gotti is the former Gambino family boss.
translation.ko: 존 고티는 감비노 패밀리의 전 보스로서

translation.en: Gotti was found guilty April 2nd
of murder, racketeering, tax evasion, and other crimes.
Gotti had escaped prosecution three times,
garnering him the name "Teflon Don."
[man] I was a member of the team that prosecuted John Gotti.
translation.ko: 전 존 고티를 기소한 팀의 일원이었어요 "필 스칼라, FBI 요원"

translation.en: 2006, I was the supervisor of the FBI Gambino squad.
We were involved with murder investigations,
international distribution of drugs, extortions.
translation.ko: 국제 마약 유통, 갈취 등을 조사했어요

translation.en: We had a number of wires going on.
One of the peripheral wires picked up something
about inside information going on with the NBA.
translation.ko: NBA 내부 정보 유출 관련 내용이 나왔죠

translation.en: [Gambino goon] We've got a ref in our hip pocket.
translation.ko: 심판 한 명을 제대로 확보해 놨어

translation.en: [FBI detective] What's his name?
[Phil] Paul Harris was the case agent.
translation.ko: 폴 해리스는 사건 조사를 맡은 요원이었어요

translation.en: He says, "Phil, we came up with three names."
translation.ko: 제게 세 명의 이름을 확보했다고 하더군요 "전화 메시지 기록이 담긴 CD"

translation.en: [FBI detective] What's his name?
[Gambino goon] Tim Donaghy.
[Phil] I didn't know Tim Donaghy from a hole in the wall,
but the fact that he came up with an active referee
translation.ko: 하지만 NBA에서 활동 중인 심판이라는 것을 알게 된 후

translation.en: in the NBA was alarming.
He's working with somebody by the name of Martino
translation.ko: 마르티노와 바티스타라는 사람들과 일을 벌이고 있었는데

translation.en: and Battista, and they do a lot of talking.
translation.ko: 마르티노와 바티스타라는 사람들과 일을 벌이고 있었는데 대화가 많이 오가더군요

translation.en: And because they do a lot of talking,
translation.ko: 주고받는 얘기가 많았기에 필라델피아 폭력 조직으로

translation.en: there's information going to the Philadelphia mob.
translation.ko: 주고받는 얘기가 많았기에 필라델피아 폭력 조직으로 흘러가는 정보도 있었어요

translation.en: There's information going offshore.
And there's information going to,
our particular interest, in the Gambino family.
[Tim] There was always instances
where you're alone with your thoughts in a hotel room.
And I said to myself,
"I shouldn't be doing this. This is not good."
"Eventually I'm gonna get caught."
But we were winning.
I was getting $2,000 for a correct pick,
and we're winning, like, 70 to 80% of the time.
It got to the point where I forgot about Battista. I forgot about the threats.
We'll do this to the end of the year. I'm gonna have fun with it, and it's over.
translation.ko: 그해 말까지만 할 테니 그때까진 즐기자는 생각으로요

translation.en: -[dramatic synth music playing] -[whistle blows]
I was refereeing with Stafford. He was buddies with Isaiah Thomas.
translation.ko: 저와 함께 심판을 맡은 스태퍼드는 아이제이아 토머스와 친구였어요

translation.en: I knew Stafford didn't have a liking for Pat Riley, even a little bit.
translation.ko: 저는 스태퍼드가 팻 라일리를 싫어하는 걸 알았고

translation.en: And I knew any chance he got,
translation.ko: 기회가 생길 때마다 라일리를 밀어붙이리란 걸 알았죠

translation.en: he'd stick it to him because he was that type of referee.
translation.ko: 기회가 생길 때마다 라일리를 밀어붙이리란 걸 알았죠 그런 성향의 심판이었거든요

translation.en: [announcer] Pat Riley screaming for a foul call,
translation.ko: "도너기의 승리 예측 팀: 뉴욕" 팻 라일리가 반칙 판정을 요구하자

translation.en: and a technical foul's gonna be called on Riley.
He yelled at Derrick Stafford.
Rose, on the drive inside, throws it to Crawford for three! Bang!
translation.ko: 페인트 존으로 들어간 로즈 크로퍼드에게 패스, 3점 슛, 성공!

translation.en: The Knicks will win their sixth straight here at Madison Square Garden.
translation.ko: "도너기가 예측한 팀 승리" 닉스가 매디슨 스퀘어 가든에서 6연승을 거둡니다

translation.en: Timmy called me after every game was over at night,
translation.ko: 티미는 밤마다 경기가 끝나면 제게 전화로 말했어요

translation.en: and he would say, "Good boy?" And I would say, "Good boy."
After every game.
Now I had extra cash in my pocket. I was happy.
Tommy would come to one of the games,
brown paper bag just like they do in the movies,
and hand it to me.
You know, it's weird because I was doing it for nothing.
translation.ko: 이상하게도 전 아무런 대가도 없이 그렇게 해 줬어요

translation.en: But I will say this,
every time I did drop money off to Timmy, he would give me some of it.
translation.ko: 티미한테 돈을 전달할 때마다 티미는 제게 수고비를 줬어요

translation.en: [Tim] When Tommy came with that brown paper bag full of money,
translation.ko: 토미가 돈을 가득 담은 갈색 종이봉투를 들고 올 때마다

translation.en: we went to the nicest strip club, like we were rock stars, that you could ever imagine.
translation.ko: 우리는 록스타라도 된 것처럼 제일 좋은 스트립 바에 갔어요

translation.en: And we'd go to the, like… the tit… titty bars.
translation.ko: 경기 후엔 나체 쇼를 보러 갔어요

translation.en: Can I say that on there?
-[whistle blows] -[Tim] I'm refereeing with Joe Crawford.
A couple of weeks prior,
he had a run-in with one of the Heat's radio or TV announcers,
translation.ko: 마이애미 히트의 라디오인가 TV의 아나운서와 싸웠는데

translation.en: and the owner of the Heat wanted him fired.
[announcer 1] …officials looking one another, Tim Donaghy and Joey Crawford.
translation.ko: 팀 도너기와 조 크로퍼드가 서로를 쳐다봅니다

translation.en: [Tim] He was the top official in the league,
and he could basically do whatever he wanted to do.
translation.ko: 원하는 건 뭐든 할 수 있는 위치였죠

translation.en: I knew any chance he got, he was gonna stick it to somebody.
translation.ko: 기회가 오면 누군가를 물고 늘어지리란 걸 알았어요

translation.en: [announcer 1] Shot clock is down to three.
And Howard is fouled by Posey.
[announcer 2] With Joe Crawford, you just don't argue.
translation.ko: 조 크로퍼드의 판정에는 반박할 수가 없죠

translation.en: [announcer 1] Only the second home-court loss
in February for the Heat in three seasons.
translation.ko: 2월에 열린 홈 경기에서 2패만을 기록했습니다 "도너기가 예측한 팀 승리"

translation.en: [Tim] We had a big bash for Kim's 40th.
I bought her a pair of earrings that cost ten thousand dollars.
[Kim] My 40th birthday present were these earrings.
I've never taken them out because I'll probably lose them.
translation.ko: 잃어버릴 것 같아서 한 번도 안 뺐어요

translation.en: [Tim] You know, things that you normally wouldn't buy, I was just buying.
translation.ko: 평소엔 안 사던 것들을 그냥 사들였죠

translation.en: Mommy, look what I got!
[Jimmy] I could lose three million one day,
win six million the next day.
translation.ko: 다음 날엔 600만 달러를 딸 수도 있었어요

translation.en: I made good money.
I was a fat fuck,
snorting coke like a rock star.
[Tommy] I was getting Battista a lot of Percocets.
translation.ko: 바티스타에게 진통제인 퍼코셋을 많이 공급해 줬어요

translation.en: He was getting Percocets himself. He was doing a lot of cocaine.
translation.ko: 본인이 직접 구하는 것도 있었고 코카인도 많이 흡입했죠

translation.en: I think I was getting him like an eight-ball a day.
translation.ko: 제가 준 코카인이 하루에 3.5g 정도 된 것 같아요

translation.en: That was just… part of the problem.
[announcer 1] Arenas splits defenders, challenges O'Neal.
translation.ko: 어리너스가 수비수 사이를 뚫고 오닐 앞으로 밀고 나갑니다

translation.en: That's the kind of play Eddie Jordan would like to see a foul called, but--
translation.ko: 에디 조던 감독은 이런 장면에서 파울을 기대하겠지만…

translation.en: [announcer 2] Eddie is not happy at all with Tim Donaghy,
translation.ko: 에디는 팀 도너기의 판정에 불만이 많아 보이네요

translation.en: and he's gonna be very, very close, but he is…
[Tim] One time we lost three games in a row.
translation.ko: 한번은 세 번 연속 예측이 빗나갔는데

translation.en: Tommy said Battista called him up screaming.
translation.ko: 토미 말로는 바티스타가 전화해서 소리를 질렀대요

translation.en: I didn't know if I was gonna go home and find my dog strangled,
translation.ko: 집으로 돌아가면 개가 목이 졸린 채

translation.en: hanging from a tree somewhere, you know, as a message.
translation.ko: 어딘가 나무에 매달려 있는 건 아닐까 생각했어요

translation.en: But bottom line was, I wasn't fixing the games.
translation.ko: 하지만 제가 승부를 조작하는 건 아니니까

translation.en: So I wasn't gonna go out there
whether we lost ten in a row and fix a game.
I had inside information,
and that's all I needed to make these picks correct.
translation.ko: 그것만 있으면 제대로 예측할 수 있었거든요

translation.en: Get the fuck out of here!
[Jimmy] He has a fucking whistle in his pocket.
He has the lottery ticket.
For the record, I bet 47 games with Timmy.
We went 37 and ten.
Thirty-seven and ten by the number. We crushed the number.
Tim Donaghy, Elvis,
he controlled the outcome.
Elvis was the King of Rock.
And Timmy was the king of fixing games.
[Tommy] We had an agreement at Marriott.
Shut the fuck up. The word was "cranberries" that we used.
"Cranberries" was the code. Shut your fucking mouth.
Keep it between us.
Stick to the fucking story.
Keep your mouth shut and don't tell anybody,
translation.ko: 입 다물고 누구에게도 발설해선 안 돼

translation.en: but we all know that that's not what he did.
Battista was giving these picks to guys
translation.ko: 바티스타는 범죄 집단인 감비노 패밀리를 위해

translation.en: that were generating millions and millions of dollars
for the Gambino crime family.
Battista always wants to say he had nothing to do with the mob in New York,
translation.ko: 바티스타는 뉴욕의 폭력 조직과 무관하다고 강조하지만

translation.en: but yet he's driving up and down once a week to drop off or pick up money.
translation.ko: 돈을 주고받으러 일주일에 한 번씩 거길 다녀왔죠

translation.en: I wasn't a mob guy, okay,
but… did I dine with them at times?
Fucking A, I did.
We were moving serious money. You had to play protocols.
translation.ko: 거액의 자금을 옮기려면 규정에 따라 움직여야 하잖아요

translation.en: If I wasn't at that table, "Who the fuck are you?"
translation.ko: 제가 그 자리에 직접 가지 않으면 누군지나 알았겠어요?

translation.en: [Phil] We did an analysis of hundreds and hundreds of phone records.
And they come to find out,
Battista was making money for the mob.
translation.ko: 폭력 조직을 위해 돈을 벌었다는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: Now, was he somebody who was going to the weddings?
Was he someone who's going to the funerals?
Was he somebody who was gonna hang out in the clubs? No.
translation.ko: 장례식에 가고 클럽에서 함께 어울렸을까요? 아니죠

translation.en: He wasn't a made guy.
But, whether he wants to admit it or not,
he was making big money for all those entities.
translation.ko: 그는 그 많은 사람을 위해 큰돈을 벌고 있었어요

translation.en: From what we understood,
somewhere between 20 and 30 million dollars.
[Tommy] I was on the beach in South Beach, Miami.
My phone rings, and it's "unavailable."
So I answered.
"Hi. This is Agent Paul Harris."
It's the FBI.
[Phil] Operation Flagrant Foul was the name of the special investigation.
When law enforcement comes knocking on your door,
most people have a degree of shock.
Especially if it's the first time.
[Tommy] I shit myself.
I got scared shitless. I didn't eat for a week.
translation.ko: 얼마나 겁에 질렸는지 일주일 동안 먹지도 못할 정도였죠

translation.en: And then when I got home, there they were.
translation.ko: 집에 가 보니 그 사람들이 와 있더군요

translation.en: They handed me a subpoena to appear before a grand jury.
"We'll see you in a week."
I used to go to three meetings a day for sobriety.
translation.ko: 약물을 끊으려고 하루에 세 번씩 모임에 나갔는데

translation.en: In the middle of a meeting, I get a text message. It goes,
"Jimmy, there's two FBI officers in the driveway. They're looking for you."
translation.ko: '지미, FBI 요원 두 명이 진입로에서 자네를 찾고 있어'

translation.en: I said, "There's a Dunkin' Donuts up the street."
translation.ko: 저는 길을 따라 올라가면 던킨도너츠가 있으니

translation.en: "I'll meet you there for a cup of coffee."
We sat down, say, "Listen, Jimmy, you need to come talk to us about this
translation.ko: 자리에 앉자 이러더군요 '지미, 일이 아주 커질 테니'

translation.en: because it's gonna get serious."
"Extortion, money-laundering, game-fixing."
"You're facing a good 25 years."
"Jimmy, either you get on the train, or you're gonna get run over by it."
And I'm like, "Fuck you guys. I'm not a rat."
translation.ko: 저는 웃기지 말라고 했어요 난 밀고자가 아니라고요

translation.en: [Tim] Me and my family, we had moved down to Florida.
-We had a nice house. -[family] ♪ Happy birthday… ♪
[Tim] Great lifestyle.
[Tim] My kids are all doing terrific.
Whoa, Meg! Let off! Let off!
[Tim] I was on the driving range at Lakewood Ranch Country Club.
Just getting ready to break out a new set of irons.
translation.ko: 새 아이언 세트를 쓰려고 준비하고 있었어요

translation.en: My phone kept ringing and ringing, and I picked it up. It was Tommy.
translation.ko: 계속 전화가 울려서 받아 보니 토미였죠

translation.en: And he just said, "Listen, I got something I got to tell you."
And I said, "What?" He goes, "The FBI was here."
"A couple times."
I said to him, "Tommy, they were there two or three times,
translation.ko: 토미에게 말했죠 '두세 번이나 찾아왔는데 그걸 이제야 얘기해?'

translation.en: and you're just telling me now?"
[Kim] He pulled up in the golf cart,
and he came in, and I remember his exact words.
"That fucking Tommy."
He would never talk about Tommy like that.
translation.ko: 토미를 절대로 그렇게 말하는 적이 없었거든요

translation.en: He said, "I have to talk to you."
He was in the fetal position on the bed,
and he said, "I took some money,
translation.ko: 침대에 웅크리고 누워서 이렇게 말했어요 '내가 돈을 좀 받으면서 해 온 일이 있어'

translation.en: and I've been doing some things."
translation.ko: '내가 돈을 좀 받으면서 해 온 일이 있어'

translation.en: And it just clicked.
I just knew, "He's betting on his own games."
He was crying, just bawling.
I hugged him.
I said, "You know what? We're gonna get through it."
translation.ko: 저는 안아 주며 말했어요 '있잖아' '우리는 이겨낼 거야 괜찮을 거야'

translation.en: "It… It's gonna be fine."
And I walked out of the bedroom, I shut the door,
and I went into the kitchen, and I threw up in the sink.
[Tim] You know, as soon as Tommy called me, I knew I was screwed.
translation.ko: 토미의 전화를 받자마자 이제 망했다는 감이 왔어요

translation.en: When you're put in the middle of something like that, you don't sleep,
translation.ko: 그런 일에 연루되면 잠도 안 오고 입맛도 없어요 세상이 끝난 기분이죠

translation.en: -you don't eat, it just… eats you alive. -[ominous music playing]
translation.ko: 잠도 안 오고 입맛도 없어요 세상이 끝난 기분이죠

translation.en: -[announcer 1] Down two games to none. -[announcer 2] And Giambi down swinging.
translation.ko: 2전 2패를 기록 중입니다 지암비가 스윙과 함께 아웃됩니다

translation.en: [man] I was sitting at home watching the Yankee game.
-[dramatic whoosh] -I got a call from Tim.
He said, "Can you meet tonight?"
translation.ko: '오늘 밤에 만날 수 있어요?' "존 로로, 팀의 변호사"

translation.en: We met at a restaurant.
I could tell he was devastated and in bad shape.
My strategy always coming into a case
instinctually is to fight.
I don't like cooperating. I like fighting. I like going to trial.
translation.ko: 저는 협조하는 것보다는 싸우고 법정까지 가는 걸 좋아해서

translation.en: So my initial reaction was, this is defensible.
And it was defensible from a legal strategic standpoint, initially.
translation.ko: 처음에는 법적, 전략적 관점에서 변호할 수 있다고 생각했는데

translation.en: It was not defensible from an emotive standpoint.
Tim had to confess.
He had to.
Moreover, we didn't know what the other characters were doing.
translation.ko: 게다가 다른 관련 인물들이 어떻게 나올지도 몰랐고요

translation.en: I didn't know where Baba was. He was coming out of rehab.
translation.ko: 재활원에서 나온 바바의 행방은 알 수 없었고

translation.en: I knew that Tommy Martino had been in to the grand jury,
translation.ko: 토미 마르티노가 대배심에 섰다는 걸 알았는데

translation.en: which is always a dangerous sign.
So we had to make a strategic decision
to go in to the US attorney's office and cooperate fully,
which we did in, like, 48 hours.
It was the quickest I've ever taken a client in.
translation.ko: 의뢰인과 함께 그렇게 빨리 협조하러 간 건 처음이었어요

translation.en: [Tommy] I go up in front of a grand jury.
Prosecuting attorney asked me,
"What were you doing on the phone with Donaghy for 9,000 minutes a month?"
translation.ko: '한 달에 9천 분씩 도너기와 무슨 통화를 했나요?'

translation.en: I said, "We were talking about family matters."
translation.ko: 저는 가정 문제를 상의했다고 했죠 "교차 참조 할 것"

translation.en: And he says, "All right, stop right there. You heard that. He lied."
I guess he wanted me to say we were talking about basketball games that he was officiating.
translation.ko: 티미가 심판하는 농구 경기에 관해 얘기했다고 자백하길 바랐나 봐요

translation.en: So they slapped me with a perjury charge.
I remember the prosecuting attorney coming to me at the turnstiles.
translation.ko: 검사가 스윙 게이트로 다가와서 이렇게 말했어요

translation.en: And he says, "Martino, your buddy Tim reffed his last NBA game."
translation.ko: '마르티노, 당신 친구 팀은 이제 NBA 심판 못 해요'

translation.en: And I thought, "Holy shit, man. We're screwed, man."
translation.ko: 그 말을 듣고 이제 우린 망했다고 생각했죠

translation.en: "My dad's gonna kill me."
-[funky music playing] -Come on.
Let's go, baby!
[John Lauro] Warren Flagg is a former FBI agent. He's my best friend.
translation.ko: 워런 플래그는 전직 FBI 요원으로 제 가장 친한 친구예요

translation.en: I would trust Warren with my life.
translation.ko: 제가 목숨도 맡길 만큼 신뢰하는 사람이죠

translation.en: [Warren] John Lauro brought me into this case.
translation.ko: 존 로로가 날 이 사건에 끌어들였어요

translation.en: He needed somebody that could match wits
translation.ko: 그 친구가 찾는 건 팀 도너기와 머리싸움을 할 사람이었어요

translation.en: with Tim Donaghy and also prepare him
translation.ko: 그 친구가 찾는 건 팀 도너기와 머리싸움을 할 사람이었어요 또한 그 어떤 검찰 협조자도 겪어 보지 못한

translation.en: for the most grueling interrogation
translation.ko: 또한 그 어떤 검찰 협조자도 겪어 보지 못한 혹독한 신문을 견디도록 도너기를 대비시켜 줄 사람이었죠

translation.en: any cooperator would ever have.
translation.ko: 혹독한 신문을 견디도록 도너기를 대비시켜 줄 사람이었죠

translation.en: So he called the Flagg Man.
[John Lauro] The worst thing you could do in Tim's situation
translation.ko: 팀이 그 상황에서 할 수 있는 최악의 행동은

translation.en: is cooperate and not tell the whole truth,
because you get caught in one lie, this is over.
translation.ko: 거짓말을 하나라도 했다가 들키면 다 끝장이니까요

translation.en: And you're going to jail for ten, 15 years. I don't know.
translation.ko: 10년 형이 될지 15년 형이 될지 알 수가 없는 거죠

translation.en: So I said to Tim, "You can't be a little pregnant."
translation.ko: 그래서 팀에게 말했어요 '약간 임신할 수는 없어요'

translation.en: "You're either pregnant, or you're not."
translation.ko: '임신을 했으면 했고 안 했으면 안 한 거죠'

translation.en: "A little pregnant, they're gonna cut your gonads off."
translation.ko: '말도 안 되는 소리를 하면 검찰이 생식기를 잘라 버릴걸요'

translation.en: [Tim] First meeting with the FBI,
Lauro came in with Phil Scala.
Immediately, Scala stood up, leaned across the table
translation.ko: 스칼라가 곧장 자리에서 일어나 탁자 위로 몸을 기울이고

translation.en: and pointed his finger right in my face and said,
"Just so you know, I got John Gotti."
"You're sitting in the same fucking seat that John Gotti sat in."
translation.ko: '당신은 존 고티가 앉았던 자리에 앉아 있고요'

translation.en: "If you think you're gonna lie to me, get the fuck up and leave right now."
[Phil] It was about him saying that he never threw a game.
translation.ko: 승부를 한 번도 조작한 적이 없다고 하더군요

translation.en: "Even though I bet, I never threw a game." And I says, "Tim, that's bullshit."
translation.ko: 베팅은 했지만 조작은 없었다길래 저는 말이 안 된다고 했어요

translation.en: The fact that you're betting on the game, your judgment is impaired and tainted.
translation.ko: 경기에 베팅하는 그 자체만으로 판단력이 흐려지는 거니까요

translation.en: [Tim] They had several United States attorneys in the room,
translation.ko: 연방 지검장 여러 명과 FBI 요원들이 한방에 모여서

translation.en: FBI agents, all grilling me about fixing games.
-[ominous music continues] -I said, "Listen."
"I never fixed games."
"I had one of the best percentages calling-wise as an NBA referee."
translation.ko: '난 오심률이 낮은 NBA 심판 중 하나예요'

translation.en: "I was rated third out of a staff of 60 people."
I said, "How could I be rated there and be fixing games?"
translation.ko: '그렇게 높은 정확성을 보이면서 어떻게 승부를 조작하겠어요?'

translation.en: [Phil] Many of the great authors and philosophers say,
translation.ko: 위대한 작가와 철학자 여럿이 이런 말을 했죠

translation.en: the first time you lie to yourself,
and then you would lie to yourself a second and third and fourth time,
translation.ko: 그게 두 번, 세 번, 네 번이 되면

translation.en: you become the lie.
You're lying to your wife. You're lying to your kids.
You're lying to your parents.
You're lying to the people that you work with.
You're lying to yourself.
And you can never live a peaceful life
when your life has become nothing but a lie.
translation.ko: 평화로운 삶을 살 수 없게 되죠

translation.en: In basketball, there are at least three or four instances
translation.ko: 농구에서는 그게 어떤 경기든 적어도 서너 번은

translation.en: in any game
translation.ko: 그게 어떤 경기든 적어도 서너 번은

translation.en: when you have to utilize your judgment.
And your judgment is tainted because you bet on that game…
[announcer 1] Tim Donaghy, the outside official, made the call late…
[Phil] …you have to admit you may have made a wrong call.
translation.ko: 잘못 판정했을 수도 있다는 걸 인정해야 해요

translation.en: [announcer 2] No, I… I don't know what he saw.
[Phil] And unless you get to that,
you don't have a cooperation agreement.
translation.ko: 협조 자체가 성립 안 되는 거죠

translation.en: He came to terms with the fact that his judgment was, in fact, tainted.
translation.ko: 결국 자기 판단력이 흐려졌다는 사실을 인정했어요

translation.en: [announcer 1] Wow. That's terrible.
[Tim] I had to sign a document that said
subconsciously I could have made calls in the game based on the bets.
translation.ko: 무의식적으로 판정했을 수 있다는 서류에 서명해야 했어요

translation.en: Now I'm not sure what the hell that meant, but at that time, I didn't care.
translation.ko: 지금은 그 말이 이해가 안 되지만 당시에는 상관없었어요

translation.en: I was signing anything. I was spent, gone.
translation.ko: 뭐든 서명해야 했어요 정신적으로 너무 지쳐서

translation.en: I just wanted the whole thing to be over with.
[Phil] During that minimum of three years that he was involved,
translation.ko: 도너기는 자신이 관여한 최소 3년의 기간 동안 "2003~2007년"

translation.en: he admitted betting on 100-plus games.
But nobody in the NBA noticed anything.
translation.ko: 하지만 NBA 관계자 누구도 눈치 못 챘죠

translation.en: If he was throwing the games and it was blatant,
the commissioner would've known.
His coworkers would have known. The owners would have known.
translation.ko: 총재나 동료들이 알아챘을 거예요 구단주들도 알았을 거고요

translation.en: The players would have known. They would've called attention to it then.
translation.ko: 선수들도 알았겠죠 그랬다면 주의를 환기했을 거예요

translation.en: Which was the reason why Tim was saying, "Well, there were other people involved."
translation.ko: 그래서 팀이 다른 사람들도 연루됐다고 말한 겁니다

translation.en: And he believed that it went all the way up the chain.
translation.ko: NBA 꼭대기까지 그 줄이 이어졌다고 믿었죠

translation.en: Welcome to the National Basketball Association.
translation.ko: 미국 프로 농구 협회에 오신 걸 환영합니다

translation.en: [Tim] Listen, I called what the NBA wanted me to call.
If they said, "Go out and make sure, you know, you concentrate on this tonight,"
translation.ko: 오늘 경기에서 판정에 신경 쓰라고 하면

translation.en: that's what I went out and concentrated on.
[John Lauro] David Stern built the league around a business model
that would highlight certain key players,
translation.ko: 유명 팀을 강조하는 비즈니스 모델을 통해

translation.en: certain high-profile teams.
Tim had this incredible insight
into the connection between the business model and the referees
translation.ko: 그 비즈니스 모델과 심판 그리고 심판이 코트에서

translation.en: and the way they reffed games in real time on the court,
translation.ko: 실시간으로 판정하는 방식의 연결 고리를 파악했고

translation.en: and that's what he's telling the FBI.
[Tim] Every playoff game meant tens of millions of dollars
translation.ko: 플레이오프 경기는 매번 리그에 수천만 달러를 벌어다 주기 때문에

translation.en: for the league, so they wanted the series
translation.ko: 리그에 수천만 달러를 벌어다 주기 때문에 경기를 최대한 7차전까지 끌고 가는 걸 원했죠

translation.en: to go towards seven games as often as possible.
translation.ko: 경기를 최대한 7차전까지 끌고 가는 걸 원했죠

translation.en: If there was a sweep, it was not good for the league's bottom line.
translation.ko: 압도적인 승리로 경기 수가 줄면 리그의 수익에 도움이 안 돼요

translation.en: [announcer 1] The Lakers, facing a playoff elimination.
The Kings, only one game away from the NBA Finals…
translation.ko: 킹스는 NBA 파이널까지 한 경기를 남겨 뒀습니다 "새크라멘토가 3승 2패로 우세"

translation.en: [Tim] I didn't referee the Lakers-Kings playoff game.
translation.ko: 레이커스 대 킹스 플레이오프는 제가 심판을 서지 않았어요

translation.en: But that game has gone down
as the worst officiated game in the history of the NBA.
translation.ko: NBA 역사상 최악의 판정이 나온 경기로 기록됐죠

translation.en: -[crowd cheering] Defense! -[announcer 1] Bibby able to--
[announcer 2] Knocked to the ground, and no foul called on that penetration.
translation.ko: 부딪혀 쓰러집니다 맷 패트릭에게 반칙을 불지 않네요

translation.en: [announcer 1] Lakers hoping to take it back to Sacramento for a game seven.
translation.ko: 레이커스는 새크라멘토로 돌아가 7차전을 치르고 싶을 겁니다

translation.en: That's number five on Webber.
[announcer 2] And this is a terrible call.
[announcer 3] He's in front of him, and he's gonna come-- Oh! An elbow!
translation.ko: 바로 앞에 서 있는데 팔꿈치를 휘둘렀거든요!

translation.en: [announcer 2] Yes. He just ran over Mike Bibby.
[announcer 1] Should have been an offensive foul.
[Tim] Those three guys that refereed that game
translation.ko: 그 경기에서 심판을 본 세 명은

translation.en: advance and get another bonus after what they just did?
translation.ko: 그따위 판정을 하고도 또 보너스를 받았잖아요

translation.en: [announcer 1] Game seven, Sunday night, in Sacramento.
[Tim] Where would you ever see that happen? In what profession?
translation.ko: 그런 경우를 또 어디서 보겠어요? 어떤 직업에서요?

translation.en: [Phil] A lot of the people Tim was speaking about…
[reporter] NBA commissioner David Stern…
[Phil] …you know, there were some significant names.
I started receiving calls from FBI headquarters saying,
"We got another lead. Take a look at this over here."
translation.ko: '또 다른 단서가 나왔어요 이것 좀 봐요'

translation.en: We had referees who had associations with management, owners, and players.
translation.ko: 운영진, 구단주, 선수와 연계된 심판들이 있었어요

translation.en: We had ten referees we were looking at.
-[dramatic music continues] -Nine involved with casino gambling.
translation.ko: 아홉 명은 카지노 도박과 관련이 있었어요

translation.en: Betting on sports, we had two.
What the case agents wanted to do was see
if we can corroborate some of his allegations.
translation.ko: 팀의 주장을 입증할 수 있는지 알아보려고 했죠

translation.en: We wanted to put a covert wire on Tim.
translation.ko: 그래서 팀의 몸에 도청기를 장착하려 했어요

translation.en: [John Lauro] Tim was gonna be a major player in a very, very significant undercover operation.
translation.ko: 아주 중요한 잠입 작전에서 팀이 핵심 역할을 맡을 예정이었죠

translation.en: Tim would be wired up and go back into the NBA
as a confidential informant.
[Warren] If you wired it up, they could then expand the investigation.
translation.ko: 도청기를 달면 수사 범위를 넓힐 수 있어요

translation.en: How many other people that they may have been dealing with?
translation.ko: 얼마나 더 많은 사람과 상대했는지 알 수 있죠

translation.en: It could have mushroomed.
[Phil] As an organized crime investigator,
you don't talk to anybody unless there's a need to know.
translation.ko: 사건 수사에 필요할 경우에만 수사 내용을 공유해요

translation.en: To me, at that point, the NBA didn't need to know.
translation.ko: 그때는 아직 NBA 쪽에 알릴 필요가 없었어요

translation.en: But my supervisor, he knew a lot about sports.
translation.ko: 그런데 스포츠 분야를 잘 아는 제 상사가

translation.en: He says, "Phil, I think this is a good idea."
We were advised that the commissioner
would definitely assist in unraveling this.
translation.ko: 사건을 해결하는 데 확실히 도움을 줄 거라고 했어요

translation.en: I said, "All right."
David Stern, in his culture, he was the boss for sure.
translation.ko: 데이비드 스턴은 그의 문화에서 확실히 우두머리였어요

translation.en: Nobody questioned him.
We go into his office.
We sat around the table, and he says, "Listen,
we want to cooperate with you guys."
"We'll give you the films. You can speak to this person,
translation.ko: 영상도 제공하고 필요한 사람들과 면담하게 해 줄 테니

translation.en: and you can speak to that person, and whatever you guys want, you have."
translation.ko: 필요한 사람들과 면담하게 해 줄 테니 뭐든 필요한 건 얘기하라고요

translation.en: They gave us access to this, that, the other thing.
We even interviewed observers.
[reporter] Observers, whose identities are kept from the officials,
evaluate the performance of each of the three game officials.
And they said, "There's nothing wrong here."
"The officiating is right on point."
At that point, you discharge everything they have to say.
translation.ko: 그 시점부터 참관인들의 말을 귀담아듣지 않았어요

translation.en: They're basically circling the wagons and going scripted on you.
translation.ko: 완벽한 방어 태세로 대본을 읊는 거나 다름없었거든요

translation.en: We got what they wanted to give us, but it was bullshit.
-To us, it was bullshit. -[intriguing music crescendos]
[John Lauro] As much as I respect Phil Scala,
he made a terrible misjudgment
by going to the NBA and telling them
translation.ko: NBA에 찾아가서 우리가 승부를 조작한 심판을 잡았다고 밝혔거든요

translation.en: that we have a ref who has compromised the game.
translation.ko: 우리가 승부를 조작한 심판을 잡았다고 밝혔거든요

translation.en: Phil Scala went into Stern's office. Immediately following that,
translation.ko: 필 스칼라가 스턴의 사무실에 다녀온 직후

translation.en: they renegotiated all their contracts
translation.ko: NBA 측에서는 "NBA의 새 TV 계약 미래를 강조하다"

translation.en: with all the networks that broadcasted NBA games.
translation.ko: NBA 경기를 중계하는 모든 방송국과 재계약했어요

translation.en: He signed a deal for 7.4 billion dollars.
The NBA shouldn't have gotten that much.
translation.ko: 그렇게 큰 금액을 받아선 안 되는 거였어요

translation.en: They knew about a bad referee
and the possibility of other bad referees going down.
translation.ko: 또 다른 부패 심판의 존재 가능성도 인지했으니까요

translation.en: But the network's, you know, dealing with somebody who had information
translation.ko: 그런데 방송국들은 내부 정보를 갖고 있으면서도

translation.en: and didn't tell the other side what he knew,
translation.ko: 상대에게 그 사실을 숨긴 사람과 계약한 거예요

translation.en: which would have lowered that price significantly.
So somebody got snookered.
[John Lauro] Tim was ready, willing, and able to be wired up
and go into the depths of the NBA to reveal the inside game.
translation.ko: NBA 내부 비리를 폭로할 준비가 돼 있었어요

translation.en: Time was of the essence.
Because once the story is out there,
nobody's gonna talk to anybody. Everybody's gonna be hunkered down.
translation.ko: 다들 입을 닫고 몸을 사릴 테니까요

translation.en: And then, all of a sudden,
there was a leak in the press,
and it blew the cover off of our undercover operation.
The irony is astounding.
The very person hired to make the players abide by the rules
translation.ko: "심판이 파울을 범하다" 선수들이 규칙을 지키게 하도록 고용된 사람이

translation.en: is suspected of cheating for money.
translation.ko: 부정행위로 돈을 번 혐의를 받고 있습니다

translation.en: Allegations of betting and foul calls by a veteran referee.
translation.ko: 베테랑 심판이 도박과 부정 판정 혐의를 받고 있습니다 "반칙?"

translation.en: An NBA ref who may have been betting on the very games he was calling.
translation.ko: "도박 조사" NBA 심판이 자신이 심판을 본 바로 그 경기에 베팅했습니다

translation.en: [reporter] Longtime NBA referee, Tim Donaghy, is…
[Tim] My face was on every TV station across the country.
translation.ko: 전국의 모든 TV 방송에 제 얼굴이 나왔어요

translation.en: -Tim Donaghy. -Tim Donaghy.
Tim Donaghy.
The story was published in the New York Post.
It was just all over the news.
Well, it is front-page news all over town…
translation.ko: 각종 매체의 1면을 장식했는데요 "승부를 조작한 심판의 반칙"

translation.en: [John Lauro] The headline was, like, "NBA games fixed."
translation.ko: 기사 제목이 죄다 그랬어요 'NBA 승부 조작'

translation.en: -"NBA ref under investigation." -[dramatic music continues]
Hate it for all the people involved. It's not… It's not fun for anybody.
translation.ko: 모든 관계자에게 괴로운 상황이죠 누구도 기뻐할 일이 아닙니다

translation.en: It's a very serious issue, and I'm sure they'll… they'll handle it accordingly.
translation.ko: 심각한 문제인 만큼 제대로 처리되리라 믿습니다 "코비 브라이언트"

translation.en: [man] This is one bad guy who made a big mistake.
He's gonna pay for it. The NBA will pay for it for a long time.
translation.ko: 대가를 치를 겁니다 NBA도 오래 대가를 치르겠죠

translation.en: This is the most serious and worst situation
translation.ko: 여태 한 번도 경험해 보지 못한

translation.en: that I have ever experienced.
[Tim] People were parked in front of the house. Helicopters flying over the house.
translation.ko: 사람들이 집 앞에 진을 치고 헬기가 집 위를 날아다녔죠

translation.en: [Kim] We lived in a gated community,
translation.ko: 외부인 출입이 제한된 주택 단지에 살았는데

translation.en: but the press paid off the guard to get into our neighborhood.
translation.ko: 기자들이 경비원들을 매수해 단지 안으로 들어온 거예요

translation.en: I was at a pub, and then all the TVs started flashing up my picture.
translation.ko: 술집에 있었는데 TV에서 제 사진이 나오자

translation.en: Some kid came over, and he slapped the New York Post down.
My face was on the front page, and he said, "Would you sign this for me?"
translation.ko: 제 얼굴이 1면에 실려 있었는데 저한테 사인을 요청했어요

translation.en: I was like, "Fuck." And I signed it. [chuckles]
[Jimmy] News networks were parked out front of my house.
translation.ko: 우리 집 앞에 뉴스 방송 기자들이 진을 쳤어요

translation.en: If I walked my dog, they were there. They were up my ass everywhere.
translation.ko: 개를 산책시키면 거기 있었고 어딜 가든 카메라를 들이밀었죠

translation.en: [John Lauro] I followed all of the news reports.
translation.ko: 뉴스 보도를 전부 다 봤는데 "'사기꾼' 심판"

translation.en: I think the press kind of got the bigger story.
translation.ko: 언론이 더 큰 건을 문 것 같았어요

translation.en: [reporter 1] Former referee Tim Donaghy's lawyers have served papers
translation.ko: 전직 심판 팀 도너기의 변호사가 주장한 바에 따르면

translation.en: that claim top NBA executives influenced referees
translation.ko: 전직 심판 팀 도너기의 변호사가 주장한 바에 따르면 NBA 고위 간부들이 자신이 선호하는 팀에게

translation.en: to make calls to benefit favored teams.
translation.ko: 유리한 판정을 하도록 심판들에게 압력을 행사했습니다

translation.en: He's a singing, cooperating witness
translation.ko: 그는 검찰에 협조하며 정보를 제공하는 증인이에요

translation.en: who is trying to get as light a sentence as he can.
[reporter 2] There are a couple possibilities.
A dirty guy who started trying to deflect the attention from him
translation.ko: 부패한 한 남자가 자신에게 향하는 관심을 돌리려고

translation.en: to say everybody else was doing it.
translation.ko: 다른 사람들도 같은 일을 했다고 주장하는 걸 수도 있고요

translation.en: Or the NBA is in massive trouble.
translation.ko: 다른 사람들도 같은 일을 했다고 주장하는 걸 수도 있고요 그게 아니라면 NBA가 아주 곤란해질 겁니다

translation.en: [David Stern] The accusations, you know, that we manipulate games,
translation.ko: 우리가 승부를 조작한다는 주장이나 "경기를 7차전까지 끌기 위해…"

translation.en: those accusations, or the facts underlying those, they're false. We don't.
translation.ko: 그 근거로 제시된 것들은 다 거짓입니다, 사실이 아니에요

translation.en: People said we're a week away from the NBA becoming
translation.ko: 이제 NBA가 세계 레슬링 협회가 될 날도

translation.en: the World Wrestling Association.
And now you've got coaches, and they would say,
"I knew that game was stolen."
I thought that was one of the worst officiated games I've ever seen. Ever.
translation.ko: 그렇게 판정이 엉망인 경기는 생전 처음 봤습니다

translation.en: I thought it was an absolute officiating travesty.
Or players saying, "I knew this guy was leaning on me."
People pay good money to come watch these athletes play.
translation.ko: 사람들은 우리 경기를 보기 위해 큰돈을 내는데

translation.en: They trying to take over the… [bleep] …game.
[Phil] But we didn't have the proactive ability
to get that on tape or corroborate it.
The gag order was out.
[John Lauro] In order to really understand this case,
translation.ko: "지난 두 시즌간 팀 도너기가 심판으로 뛴 경기 검토 중" 이 사건을 제대로 이해하려면

translation.en: you have to know how that leak happened.
translation.ko: 그 정보가 어떻게 누출됐는지 알아야 해요

translation.en: I don't know that Stern leaked the story.
translation.ko: 스턴이 그 얘기를 밖으로 흘렸는지는 모르겠어요

translation.en: I don't know that, and I'm not gonna say that.
translation.ko: 그건 제가 알 수 없고 그렇게 주장하지도 않을 거예요

translation.en: It was not in our interest to do that or in the FBI's interest to do that.
translation.ko: 우리나 FBI에는 전혀 도움이 되지 않았어요

translation.en: But it was in the interest of the NBA to leak the story.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 이야기가 새 나가면 NBA는 유리해질 수 있었죠

translation.en: It put an end to the investigation.
[reporter 1] In Brooklyn today, a former National Basketball Association referee
translation.ko: 오늘 브루클린에서 전직 미국 프로 농구 협회 심판이

translation.en: pleaded guilty to two charges related to his role in an NBA gambling scandal.
translation.ko: NBA 도박 스캔들의 두 혐의에 대해 유죄를 인정했습니다

translation.en: Tim Donaghy admitted to betting on games he officiated.
translation.ko: 팀 도너기는 심판을 맡은 경기에 베팅한 사실을 인정했습니다

translation.en: [Tim] I plead guilty to gambling and wire fraud.
You know, I definitely did something wrong.
It's probably fair.
[reporter 2] This afternoon in federal court,
42-year-old James Battista
and 41-year-old Thomas Martino were charged with being
translation.ko: 42세의 제임스 바티스타와 41세의 토머스 마르티노는 도너기의 내부 정보를 유용한 혐의로 기소됐습니다

translation.en: the two men who benefited from Donaghy's inside information.
translation.ko: 도너기의 내부 정보를 유용한 혐의로 기소됐습니다

translation.en: [Tommy] I thought about pleading not guilty.
Battista kept telling me, "They don't know nothing." "They don't know nothing."
Because Battista was not saying a word no matter what.
translation.ko: 바티스타는 무슨 일이 있어도 절대 입을 열지 않았고…

translation.en: -[reporter 3] Anything to say? -No, he doesn't right now. Thanks.
translation.ko: - 의뢰인은 하실 말씀 있나요? - 없을 거예요, 고맙습니다

translation.en: [Tommy] And his objective was for me not to either.
[Jimmy] I took the sharpest guy I had when it came to criminal defense,
translation.ko: 저는 형사 변호사로는 가장 영리한 사람이었던

translation.en: which was Jack McMahon.
McMahon. M-C-M-A-H-O-N.
-[reporter 4] First name? -Jack. [reporter 4] Jack. Thanks.
I always would take the illegal gambling because I gambled for a living.
translation.ko: 난 도박으로 먹고살았으니 불법 도박은 받아들였을 거예요

translation.en: I claimed it in taxes!
But the fraud and the wire fraud that was on the table, federally,
translation.ko: 하지만 연방 정부에서 문제 삼은 사기와 유선 사기 때문에

translation.en: and Jimmy was fucked for life.
So my thing is, "No, no, no." "I'm not taking it. I'd rather go to trial."
translation.ko: 그래서 그건 못 받아들이겠다며 차라리 법정에 서겠다고 했죠

translation.en: [Tommy] What changed my strategy was when the prosecuting attorney
translation.ko: 제가 전략을 바꾸게 된 계기는 검사 때문이었어요

translation.en: was gonna have my mom go up in front of a grand jury, and she had cancer.
translation.ko: 암 환자인 엄마를 대배심 앞에 세우겠다고 했거든요

translation.en: They were bleeding my family dry.
My brother went up. I went up.
But I was not gonna have them bring my mom up.
translation.ko: 엄마까지 그 자리에 서게 할 순 없어서

translation.en: So I just went in.
I'd had enough. I'm glad I did.
I plead guilty to wire fraud.
Using my cell phones to cheat the NBA.
translation.ko: 내 휴대전화를 이용해 NBA를 속인 거죠

translation.en: I got, "Tommy perjured-himself Martino."
"Timmy Elvis-the-rat Donaghy."
When push came to shove,
they… they weren't cranberries.
They weren't cranberries. They folded.
translation.ko: 입 다물 생각 없이 굴복해 버렸거든요

translation.en: [Jimmy] The only one left was me
and my lawyer, Jack McMahon.
I said, "Just fucking hold out." "They'll cave."
translation.ko: 제가 그냥 버티자고 했죠 그들이 항복할 거라고요

translation.en: I had enough information that either they're going to walk with me or go against me.
translation.ko: 그들이 제 편이 되든 적이 되든 제게는 충분한 정보가 있었죠

translation.en: I told them we were putting every NBA official on the stand.
translation.ko: NBA의 모든 심판을 법정에 세우겠다고 했어요

translation.en: I was tired, exhausted.
All of a sudden, Jack's ripping them, calling my phone.
translation.ko: 갑자기 잭이 다급하게 제게 전화를 걸었어요

translation.en: Someone was calling Jack for me to take a deal.
translation.ko: 누군가 잭에게 연락해 저와의 거래를 요청했대요

translation.en: So it was, "All you gotta do is plead to the illegal gambling."
translation.ko: 불법 도박 혐의만 인정하면 된다고 했죠

translation.en: They dropped the most significant things.
I'm happy, but I'm thinking to myself,
"Holy shit. David Stern controls everybody."
The NBA did not want this to go to trial,
translation.ko: "연방 정부도 이 점을 인정했습니다" NBA는 재판까지 가는 걸 원치 않았어요

translation.en: whether it was me or whether it was Battista.
There's no doubt in my mind
that that trial would have been a bloodbath for the NBA. No doubt.
translation.ko: 재판까지 갔다면 NBA가 엄청난 피해를 봤을 게 분명해요

translation.en: [Phil] People wouldn't have trusted the game anymore.
translation.ko: 사람들이 더는 경기를 믿고 보지 않았을 거예요

translation.en: Every time their team lost, you blame it on the official.
translation.ko: 팀이 질 때마다 심판 탓을 했겠죠

translation.en: Whether it was right or wrong.
Once you lose integrity, it's difficult to get it back.
translation.ko: 믿음이란 게 한번 잃으면 되돌리기 힘들거든요

translation.en: [reporter] Let me read the statement from NBA commissioner David Stern.
translation.ko: 데이비드 스턴 NBA 총재의 성명을 읽어 보겠습니다

translation.en: "Tim Donaghy repeated his allegations against his former colleagues,
translation.ko: '팀 도너기는 전 동료들을 비롯해 NBA 심판과 NBA의 혐의를'

translation.en: NBA referees, as well as the NBA."
"Those allegations have been fully investigated by the FBI and the US attorney's office."
"In addition, the NBA appointed Lawrence Pedowitz to lead
a comprehensive, independent review of the NBA's officiating program,
and Mr. Pedowitz's review revealed
that the NBA's core of values, neutrality, and accountability
were not compromised by anyone other than Mr. Donaghy." Wow.
translation.ko: '도너기 씨 외의 다른 누구도 훼손하지 않았음이 확인됐습니다' "보고서: 오직 도너기의 잘못"

translation.en: -[reporter 1] Were you inside? -[reporter 2] I was not. Were you?
translation.ko: - 안녕하세요, 안에 있었어요? - 밖에 있었는데 그쪽은요?

translation.en: [reporter 1] Yeah, he got 15 months.
[reporter 2] Fifteen months is what I hear. Three years probation.
[Tim] My sentence was 15 months in a Pensacola federal prison.
translation.ko: 저는 펜서콜라 연방 교도소에서 15개월 형을 살게 됐어요

translation.en: I thought maybe without having a prior criminal record
and, you know, basically cooperating with the government
translation.ko: 전과가 없고 정부 조사에 협조했으니 보호 관찰만 받지 않을까 했는데

translation.en: that, you know, maybe I would get probation.
translation.ko: 정부 조사에 협조했으니 보호 관찰만 받지 않을까 했는데

translation.en: Not in my wildest dreams did I think I was gonna go to jail for 15 months.
translation.ko: 15개월 동안 감옥에 갈 줄은 꿈에도 몰랐어요

translation.en: [Tommy] They gave me a year and a day.
I went to MDC Brooklyn. Battista was there with me.
translation.ko: 저는 MDC 브루클린에 수감됐어요 바티스타도 같이 갔고요

translation.en: And I got 15 months which…
Thank you, Lord.
How do you explain to a five-year-old that their dad's going to prison?
translation.ko: 다섯 살짜리한테 아빠가 감옥에 간다는 걸 어떻게 설명하겠어요?

translation.en: You know? [chuckles tearfully] I told them that Dad made a mistake
translation.ko: 아빠가 감옥에 간다는 걸 어떻게 설명하겠어요? 아이들에게는 아빠가 실수로

translation.en: and he took some money and he wasn't supposed to,
so he had to go to time-out camp.
Yeah.
[Tim] Kim had moved out.
She said she wanted a divorce.
I remember driving over the Skyway Bridge thinking,
you know, "I should just get out and jump."
[Phil] Looking at it from the big picture,
for what he did and lessons learnt,
I think he got off… easy.
You were dealing with the NBA,
with a lot of power, a lot of clout, a lot of money.
Stern amassed a small army to make sure
translation.ko: 스턴은 이 일이 큰 문제로 번지지 않도록

translation.en: this didn't cause significant damage, and you wanna know something?
translation.ko: 소규모 군대를 꾸렸어요 그런데 그거 아세요?

translation.en: He encapsulated it.
And also, our investigation into dozens of areas of information
translation.ko: "미연방 지방 법원" 그리고 우리가 팀에게서 받은 "미연방 수사국" 수십 가지 분야의 정보를 조사하며 분명하게 결론이 났어요

translation.en: that we got from Tim
translation.ko: 수십 가지 분야의 정보를 조사하며 분명하게 결론이 났어요

translation.en: led us to the point that it was clear
translation.ko: 수십 가지 분야의 정보를 조사하며 분명하게 결론이 났어요 "플레그런트 파울 작전"

translation.en: that we were not going to indict anybody else.
translation.ko: 우린 다른 사람을 기소하지 않을 판이었죠

translation.en: [Jimmy] Was Phil working for the NBA? He wasn't working for the government,
translation.ko: 필이 NBA를 위해 일했나요? 정부를 위해 일한 건 아니죠

translation.en: because why didn't they go after everybody else?
translation.ko: 정부 밑에서 일했다면 왜 다른 사람들을 조사 안 해요?

translation.en: Sixty NBA referees were fucking questioned on gambling.
-Forty-five admitted to it, yes? -[gates slamming shut]
[shouting] Did Phil and the fucking boys go after them?
translation.ko: 필과 그 조무래기들은 그들을 조사 안 했어요

translation.en: Uh-uh. Why? Big Daddy Stern said,
"Put this bitch to bed!" They could not get it out.
[producer] Stern offered you a job in the course of the investigation.
translation.ko: 스턴이 수사 과정에서 당신에게 일자리를 제안했다는데

translation.en: Is that true?
[chuckles] He pulls me… Stern pulls me aside.
He says, "You know, I could use people like you."
Now, was… was I looking for a job?
Would I ever entertain a job from somebody I was investigating?
translation.ko: 제가 조사하던 사람한테서 일자리를 받을 의향이 있었을까요?

translation.en: Not even close.
[Jimmy] They gave Tim his pension. He got minimal time.
translation.ko: NBA는 팀에게 연금을 줬고 팀은 최소 형량을 받았어요

translation.en: It's make it simple. He was a rogue official.
Listen, anything that Battista says, he's full of shit.
translation.ko: 바티스타가 무슨 말을 하든 다 헛소리예요

translation.en: Nothing that comes out of that guy's mouth is the truth.
translation.ko: 그놈 입에서 나오는 말은 하나같이 거짓말뿐이에요

translation.en: We think we have here
a rogue, isolated criminal.
Most of the refs, we believed,
were honest in calling the game as they had seen it.
As far as you know, you were the only ref who was placing bets?
As far as I understand, yes.
I can't stand informants, and I can't stand rats,
translation.ko: 정보원이나 밀고자도 도저히 견딜 수가 없지만

translation.en: but I really can't stand people that can't tell the truth.
translation.ko: 사실을 털어놓지 못하는 인간은 더 참을 수가 없어요

translation.en: And it was a cover-up from the beginning.
[reporter 1] The NBA already hurting due to referee Tim Donaghy's confession.
translation.ko: "NBA 심판 부서 구조 조정" 도너기 심판의 자백으로 NBA는 이미 피해를 봤습니다

translation.en: Phone records show that Donaghy called a second referee many times
during the 2006-2007 season.
[reporter 2] During the time Donaghy was betting on games, he made 134 calls
translation.ko: 도너기는 경기에 베팅할 때 스콧 포스터에게 경기 전후로

translation.en: to Scott Foster before and after games.
translation.ko: 도너기는 경기에 베팅할 때 스콧 포스터에게 경기 전후로 134차례 전화를 걸었습니다

translation.en: I think that Donaghy had another person he was working with, okay?
translation.ko: 도너기가 함께 일한 사람이 또 있었던 것 같아요

translation.en: There's another NBA official. His name was Scott Foster.
translation.ko: 스콧 포스터라고 하는 또 다른 NBA 심판이 있거든요

translation.en: -[intriguing music playing] -I look at Timmy's phone records,
